clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Lung Injury From COVID-19 Infection With Intravenous Sodium Nitrite
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Lung Injury From COVID-19 Infection With Intravenous Sodium Nitrite: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase 2 Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: This multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial will evaluate the efficacy and safety of intravenous Sodium Nitrite Injection for treatment of patients infected with COVID-19 who develop lung injury and require mechanical ventilation.

detailed_description.textblock: This Phase 2, multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial will evaluate the efficacy and safety of intravenous Sodium Nitrite Injection for treatment of patients infected with COVID-19 who develop lung injury and require mechanical ventilation. The primary objective is to compare the two treatment groups with respect to the proportion of study subjects who are alive and free of respiratory failure at Day 28.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of study subjects who are alive and free of respiratory failure at Day 28

Number of days alive and not in the intensive care unit from start of study through Day 28.
Number of days alive and not in hospital from start of study through Day 28.
Alive on Day 28 and no use of ECMO therapy any time between start of study and Day 28.

other_outcome.description: Liver function tests (ALT and AST) at Day 14
